name: places/ChIJn7pkApxZwokRLxQi6aGnd2k
formattedAddress: 200 E 11th St # 2B, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 E 11th St # 2B, New York, NY 10003-7322, USA

originalText.text:
I was visiting NYC for the first time and wanted a different way to see the city. I bought a DSLR many years ago and fooled around with the basics, but really wanted to capture some great images so I decided to look at photo tours.

I came across Citifari and ended up taking 3 tours with them: Landmarks, NY by Night, and Central Park with Ciro, Gildo, and Peter respectively. These tours were great! I got some amazing photos and really came away with a different way of looking at how to compose pictures to make them more visually interesting. If you're lucky like me, you may be the only person on a particular tour that day and get one-on-one attention.

Highly recommend if you want a different way of seeing the city and want to learn to take better photographs!

originalText.text:
I have been around at night with Gildo last week.

It was fantastic! Although I know, how to use my camera, I would feel uncomfortable walking through NYC at night alone with all the expensive equipment, trying to find good spots for night photography. Also as a short time visitor I simply don't have enough time to find the sweet spots. So this tour was really great for me and even though I know my camera (and photography) well, there were still some tricks I didn't know, which Gildo explained patiently to me.

Aside of taking great pictures it was also much fun and relaxing to be accompanied by a professional.

Thanks a lot!

originalText.text:
Had a great experience with Rob A. as my photo tour guide during a recent vacation trip to NYC.  He was extremely knowledgeable concerning photography and specifically in assisting with capturing some really great NYC moments and sights, was professional and courteous to both myself, my wife, and all the people of the city whom we ran across, and was incredibly personable while the tour progressed.

I'd definitely recommend anyone toying with the idea of taking a photo tour with Citifari to take the jump.  The experience was great for me and I have no doubt it will be great for all other potential clients!

originalText.text:
I took Central Park Photo Tour and it was great!!

I booked Central Park Photo Tour during a vacation trip to NYC. To tour happened one day after I bought my first DSLR camera. I can say I 100% of pictures I shoot after the tour, on 10 days remaining of my trip, I used manual controls.

Rob was great. He has great skills with photography and easy to teach. Besides, he's such a pleasant and helpful person. I took photos I could never imagine I can shoot :-)

I definitely recommend.

originalText.text: I took the NYC Night tour on 9/17 with Gildo as our guide.  He was a great guide both as a tour guide, and as a photography instructor.  I even managed to pick up a few tips and made some pretty good photos.  I had a great time, I highly recommend the tour, and I myself will take another soon, especially another with Gildo.
